intro: Aspidostemon manongarivensis, commonly known as the Manongarivensis moonflower, is a rare flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plant has compound leaves with lanceolate leaflets and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
